original: tasyādatte svayaṃ devī patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ jalam /
analyzed: tasya ādatte svayam devī patram puṣpam phalam jalam
translated: The Goddess herself accepts the leaf, flower, fruit, and water.

original: śilā praśastā pūjāyāṃ sthaṇḍilaṃ nirjanaṃ tathā // //
analyzed: śilā praśastā pūjāyām sthaṇḍilam nirjanam tathā
translated: A stone is recommended for worship, as well as an altar in a secluded place.

analyzed: japaḥ ca upāṃśu sarveṣām uttamaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: And muttering under the breath is declared the best for all.

analyzed: aśuciḥ na mahāmāyām pūjayet tu kadācana
translated: One should never worship the Great Goddess while impure.

analyzed: avaśyam tu smaret mantram naraḥ
translated: A man who is endowed with excessive devotion must certainly remember the mantra.

original: dantarakte samutpanne smaraṇaṃ ca na vidyate // //
analyzed: danta rakte samutpanne smaraṇam ca na vidyate
translated: When blood flows from the teeth, there is no recollection.

original: sarveṣāmeva mantrāṇāṃ smaraṇannarakaṃ vrajet /🔽jānūrdhve kṣataje jāte nityaṃ karma na cācaret // //
analyzed: sarveṣām eva mantrāṇām smaraṇat narakam vrajet  jānu ūrdhve kṣataje jāte nityam karma na ca ācaret
translated: For all mantras, the absence of recollection leads to hell.🔽When blood flows from the knee upwards, one should not perform the daily rites.

original: namittikaṃ ca tadadhaḥ sravadrakto na cācaret /🔽sūtake ca samutpanne kṣurakarmaṇi maithune // //
analyzed: namittikam ca tad adhas sravat raktaḥ na ca ācaret  sūtake ca samutpanne kṣura karmaṇi maithune
translated: If blood flows from below the knee, one should not perform the daily rites.🔽When there is birth pollution, shaving, or sexual intercourse,

analyzed: dhūmodgāre tathā vānte nityakarmāṇi saṃtyajet
translated: one should abandon the daily rites, as well as when there is belching or vomiting.

original: dravye bhukte tvajīrṇe ca na vai bhuktvā ca kiñcana // //
analyzed: dravye bhukte tu ajīrṇe ca na vai bhuktvā ca kiñcana
translated: When one has eaten food that is not digested, or when one has eaten anything,

original: karma kuryānnaro nityaṃ sūtake mṛtake tathā /🔽patraṃ puṣpaṃ ca tāmbūlaṃ bheṣajatvena kalpitam // //🔽kaṇādipippalyantaṃ ca phalaṃ bhuktvā na cācaret /
analyzed: karma kuryāt naraḥ nityam sūtake mṛtake tathā  patram puṣpam ca tāmbūlam bheṣaja tvena kalpitam  kaṇā ādi pippalī antam ca phalam bhuktvā na ca ācaret
translated: a man should not perform the daily rites, whether there is birth pollution or death pollution.🔽A leaf, flower, or betel nut that is used as medicine,🔽and a fruit from kanaka to pippali, one should not perform the daily rites after eating.

analyzed: jalasya api nara śreṣṭha bhojanāt bheṣajāt ṛte
translated: O best of men, even in the case of water, one should not perform the daily rites, except for medicinal purposes.

analyzed: nityakriyā nivarteta saha naimittikaiḥ sadā
translated: The daily rites, along with the occasional rites, should always be abandoned.

analyzed: jalaukām gūḍhapādam ca kṛmi gaṇḍūpada ādikam
translated: The leech, the hidden-footed insect, the worm, the mole, and so on,

analyzed: kāmāt hastena saṃspṛśya nityakarmāṇi saṃtyajet
translated: Having touched with the hand out of desire, one should abandon the daily rites.

analyzed: viśeṣataḥ śivā pūjām pramīta pitṛkaḥ naraḥ
translated: In particular, a man whose father has died should not perform the worship of Shiva.

analyzed: yāvat vatsara paryantam manasā api na ācaret
translated: For as long as a year, one should not perform even mentally.

analyzed: mahā guru nipāte tu kāmyam kiñcid na ca ācaret  /
translated: In the case of the fall of the great guru, one should not perform any desired rite at all.

original: ārtvijyaṃ brahmayajñaṃ ca śrāddhaṃ devayajaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: ārtvijyam brahmayajñam ca śrāddham deva yajam ca yat
translated: The priestly duties, the Brahmanical sacrifice, the ancestral offering, and the worship of the gods,

original: gurumākṣipya vipraṃ ca prahṛtyaiva ca pāṇinā // //🔽na kuryānnityakarmāṇi retaḥpāte ca bhairava /
analyzed: gurum ākṣipya vipram ca prahṛtya eva ca pāṇinā  na kuryāt nityakarmāṇi retaḥ pāte ca bhairava
translated: Having slandered the guru and the brahmin, and having struck with the hand,🔽One should not perform the daily rites, and in the case of emission of semen, O Bhairava.

original: āsanaṃ cārghyapātraṃ ca bhagnamāsādayennatu // //🔽ūṣare kṛmisaṃyukte sthāne mṛṣṭe'pi nārcayet /
analyzed: āsanam ca arghya pātram ca bhagnam āsādayet na tu  ūṣare kṛmi saṃyukte sthāne mṛṣṭe api na arcayet
translated: One should not use a broken seat or a vessel for offering,🔽One should not worship in a barren place infested with worms, even if it is clean.

original: nīcairāsanamāsādya śuciḥ prayatamānasaḥ // //🔽arcayeccaṇḍikāṃ devīṃ devamanyaṃ ca bhairava /
analyzed: nīcais āsanam āsādya śuciḥ prayata mānasaḥ  arcayet caṇḍikām devīm devam anyam ca bhairava
translated: Having occupied a low seat, being pure and with a controlled mind,🔽One should worship Goddess Chandika and other gods, O Bhairava.

original: digvibhāge tu kauberī dik chivā pratidāyinī // //
analyzed: diś vibhāge tu kauberī diś śivā pratidāyinī
translated: In the division of directions, the northern direction is auspicious and bestows Shiva.

analyzed: tasmāt tad mkhe āsīnaḥ pūjayet caṇḍikām sadā
translated: Therefore, sitting in that direction, one should always worship Chandika.

analyzed: puṣpam ca kṛmi saṃmiśram viśīrṇam bhagna mṛd gate
translated: A flower mixed with worms, torn, broken, and fallen on the ground,

analyzed: mūṣika uddhūtam yatnena parivarjayet
translated: Along with hair and blown by a mouse, one should carefully avoid.

original: yācitaṃ parakīyaṃ ca tathā paryuṣitaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: yācitam parakīyam ca tathā paryuṣitam ca yat
translated: One should carefully avoid what is begged, what belongs to others, what is stale,

original: antyasṛṣṭaṃ padā spṛṣṭaṃ yatnena parivarjayet // //🔽idaṃ śivāyāḥ paramaṃ manoharaṃ
analyzed: antya sṛṣṭam padā spṛṣṭam yatnena parivarjayet  idam śivāyāḥ paramam manoharam
translated: what is touched with the foot, and what is produced at the end.

original: karoti yo'nena tadīyapūjanam /🔽sa vāñchitārthaṃ samavāpya caṇḍikā
analyzed: karoti yonena tadīya pūjanam  sa vāñchita artham samavāpya caṇḍikā
translated: He who worships with this, which is supremely delightful to Shiva,

analyzed: gṛham prayātā nacireṇa bhairava
translated: obtains the desired object, O Bhairava, and then goes home in no time, O Chandika.

analyzed: iti śrī kālikāpurāṇe aurva sagara saṃvāde mahāmāyā kalpaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Mahamaya Kalpa in the Kalika Purana, in the dialogue between Aurva and Sagara.

analyzed: añcapañcāśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: The fifty-fifth chapter.

analyzed: ṣaṭpañcāśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: The fifty-sixth chapter

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

analyzed: asya mantrasya kavacam śṛṇu vetāla bhairava
translated: Listen, O Vetala-Bhairava, to the armor of this mantra,

analyzed: vaiṣṇavītantra saṃjñasya vaiṣṇavyāḥ ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: of the Vaishnava Tantra, and especially of Vaishnavi.

analyzed: tatra mantra ādi akṣaram tu vāsudeva sva rūpa dhṛk
translated: There, the first letter of the mantra holds the form of Vasudeva,

analyzed: varṇaḥ dvitīyaḥ brahmā eva tṛtīyaḥ candraśekharaḥ
translated: the second letter is Brahma, and the third is Chandra-shekara.

original: caturtho gajavaktraśca pañcamastu divākaraḥ /🔽śaktiḥ svayaṃ pakāraśca mahāmāyā jaganmayī // //
analyzed: caturthaḥ gajavaktraḥ ca pañcamaḥ tu divākaraḥ  śaktiḥ svayam pakāraḥ ca mahāmāyā jagat mayī
translated: The fourth is Gajavaktra, the fifth is Divakara,🔽the letter Pa is Shakti herself, the great Maya, the universe-pervading.

analyzed: yakāraḥ tu mahā lakṣmīḥ śeṣa varṇaḥ
translated: The letter Ya is Maha-Lakshmi, and the remaining letter is Sarasvati.
The first syllable of the Yoginī is declared to be Śailā.

original: dvitīyasya tu varṇasya caṇḍikā yoginī matā /
analyzed: dvitīyasya tu varṇasya caṇḍikā yoginī matā
translated: The second syllable is considered to be Caṇḍikā, the Yoginī.

original: candraghaṇṭā tṛtīyasya kuṣmāṇḍī tat parasya ca // //
analyzed: candraghaṇṭā tṛtīyasya kuṣmāṇḍī tat parasya ca
translated: The third syllable is Candraghantā, and the next is Kuṣmāṇḍī.

analyzed: skandamātā takārasya pasya kātyāyanī svayam
translated: The letter Ta is Skandā, and the letter Pa is Kātyāyanī herself.

analyzed: kālarātriḥ saptamasya mahādevī iti saṃsthitā
translated: The seventh syllable is established as Mahādevī, the Night of Destruction.

analyzed: prathamam varṇa kavacam yoginī kavacam tathā
translated: The first is the Varṇakavaca, then the Yoginīkavaca,

original: devaughakavacaṃ paścād devīdikkavacaṃ tathā // //🔽tatastu pārśvakavacaṃ dvitīyāntāvyayasya ca /🔽kavacaṃ tu tataḥ paścāt ṣaḍvarṇaṃ kavacaṃ tathā // //
analyzed: deva ogha kavacam paścāt devī diś kavacam tathā  tatas tu pārśva kavacam dvitīya anta avyayasya ca  kavacam tu tatas paścāt ṣaṣ varṇam kavacam tathā
translated: then the Devaugha-kavaca, and then the Devīdik-kavaca.🔽Then the Pārśva-kavaca, and then the Kavaca of the indeclinable ending in the second,

analyzed: abhedya kavacam ca iti sarva trāṇa parāyaṇam
translated: then the Kavaca of the six syllables, and then the Abhedya-kavaca, which is devoted to protection everywhere.

analyzed: imāni kavacāni aṣṭau yaḥ jānāti nara uttamaḥ
translated: The best of men who knows these eight Kavacas,

analyzed: saḥ ham eva mahādevī devī rūpaḥ ca śaktimān
translated: he is myself, the great goddess, and I am powerful in the form of the goddess.

analyzed: asya vaiṣṇavītantra kavacasya ārada ṛṣi anuṣup chandaḥ
translated: The sage of this Vaiṣṇavī Tantra Kavaca is Ārada, the meter is Anuṣṭubh.

analyzed: kātyāyanī devatā sarva kāma artha sādhane viniyogaḥ
translated: The deity is Kātyāyanī, the application is for accomplishing all desired objects.

original: aḥ pātu pūrvakāṣṭhāyāmāgneyyāṃ pātu kaḥ sadā // //
analyzed: aḥ pātu pūrva kāṣṭhāyām āgneyyām pātu kaḥ sadā
translated: May the letter A always protect me in the eastern quarter, and the letter Ka in the south-east.

original: pātu co yamakāṣṭhāyāṃ do naiṛtyāṃ ca sarvadā /🔽māṃ pātu to'sau pāścātye śaktirvāyavyadiggatā // //🔽yaḥ pātu māṃ cottarasyāmaiśānyāṃ astathāvatu /
analyzed: pātu caḥ yama kāṣṭhāyām daḥ naiṛtyām ca sarvadā  mām pātu tosau pāścātye śaktiḥ vāyavya diś gatā  / yaḥ pātu mām ca uttarasyām aiśānyām
translated: May the letter Ya always protect me in the southern quarter, and the letter Da in the south-west.🔽May the letter Ma protect me in the western quarter, and the letter Sha in the north-west.🔽May the letter Ya protect me in the northern quarter, and the letter A protect me in the north-east.

original: mūdhni rakṣatu māṃ so'sau bāhau māṃ dakṣiṇe tu kaḥ // //🔽māṃ vāmabāhau caḥ pātu hṛdi ṭo māṃ sadāvatu /
analyzed: mūdhni rakṣatu mām saḥ usau bāhau mām dakṣiṇe tu kaḥ  / mām vāma bāhau caḥ pātu hṛdi ṭaḥ mām sadā avatu
translated: May that letter Sa protect my head, and the letter Ka my right arm.🔽May the letter Cha always protect me in the left arm, and the letter Ta in the heart.

original: taḥ pātu kaṇṭhadeśe māṃ kaṭyoḥ śaktistathāvatu // //
analyzed: taḥ pātu kaṇṭha deśe mām kaṭyoḥ śaktiḥ tathā avatu  /
translated: May the letter Tha protect me in the throat, and the letter Sha protect me in the hips.

original: yaḥ pātu dakṣiṇe pāde ṣo māṃ vāmapāde tathā /
analyzed: yaḥ pātu dakṣiṇe pāde ṣaḥ mām vāma pāde tathā
translated: May the letter Ya protect my right foot, and the letter Sha my left foot.

original: śailaputrī tu pūrvasyāmāgneyyāṃ pātu caṇḍikā // //🔽candraghaṇṭā pātu yāmyāṃ amabhītivivardhinī /
analyzed: śailaputrī tu pūrvasyām āgneyyām pātu caṇḍikā  candraghaṇṭā pātu yāmyām ama bhīti vivardhinī
translated: May Shailputri always protect me in the east, and Chandrika in the south-east.

original: nairṛtye tvatha kūṣmāṇḍī pātu māṃ jagatāṃ prasūḥ // //🔽skandamātā paścimāyāṃ māṃ rakṣatu sadaiva hi /
analyzed: nairṛtye tu atha kūṣmāṇḍī pātu mām jagatām prasūḥ   skandamātā paścimāyām mām rakṣatu sadā eva hi
translated: May Chandraghata, the increaser of fearlessness, protect me in the south, and Koshmasundari, the mother of the worlds, in the south-west.

original: kātyāyanī māṃ vāyavye pātu lokeśvarī sadā // //
analyzed: kātyāyanī mām vāyavye pātu loka īśvarī sadā
translated: May Skandamata always protect me in the west, and Katyayani, the goddess of the world, in the north-west.

original: kālarātrī tu kauberyāṃ sadā rakṣatu māṃ svayam /
analyzed: kālarātrī tu kauberyām sadā rakṣatu mām svayam
translated: May Kalaratri herself always protect me in the north.

original: mahāgaurī tathaiśānyāṃ satataṃ pātu pāvanī // //🔽netrayorvāsudevo māṃ pātu nityaṃ sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: mahāgaurī tathā aiśānyām satatam pātu pāvanī  / netrayoḥ vāsudevaḥ mām pātu nityam sanātanaḥ
translated: May the great purifier Gauri always protect from the northeast.🔽May the eternal Vasudeva always protect my eyes.

original: brahmā māṃ pātu vadane padmayonirayonijaḥ // //🔽nāsābhāge rakṣatu māṃ sarvadā candraśekharaḥ /🔽gajavaktraḥ stanayugme pātu nityaṃ harātmajaḥ // //
analyzed: brahmā mām pātu vadane padmayoniḥ ayonijaḥ  nāsā bhāge rakṣatu mām sarvadā candraśekharaḥ  gajavaktraḥ stana yugme pātu nityam hara ātmajaḥ
translated: May Brahma, born from the lotus, not born from a womb, always protect my face.🔽May the moon-crested Shiva always protect the region of my nose.🔽May the son of Shiva, the elephant-faced one, always protect my pair of breasts.

original: vāmadakṣiṇapāṇyormāṃ nityaṃ pātu divākaraḥ /🔽mahāmāyā svayaṃ nābhau māṃ pātu parameśvarī // //
analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇa pāṇyoḥ mām nityam pātu divākaraḥ  mahāmāyā svayam nābhau mām pātu parameśvarī
translated: May the sun always protect my left and right hands.🔽May the great goddess Mahamaya always protect my navel.

analyzed: mahā lakṣmīḥ pātu guhye jānunoḥ ca sarasvatī
translated: May MahaLakshmi protect my private parts, and Saraswati my knees.

original: mahāmāyā pūrvabhāge nityaṃ rakṣatu māṃ śubhā // //
analyzed: mahāmāyā pūrva bhāge nityam rakṣatu mām śubhā  /
translated: May the auspicious Mahamaya always protect my eastern direction.

analyzed: agnijvālā tathā āgneyyām pāyāt nityam varāsinī
translated: May Agni-Jwala, the wielder of an excellent sword, always protect my southeast direction.

original: rudrāṇī pātu māṃ yāmyāṃ nairṛtyāṃ caṇḍanāyikā // //
analyzed: rudrāṇī pātu mām yāmyām nairṛtyām caṇḍanāyikā
translated: May Rudrani protect my southern direction, and Chandanayika my southwest direction.

analyzed: ugracaṇḍā paścimāyām pātu nityam maheśvarī
translated: May the great goddess Ugrachandra always protect my western direction.

analyzed: pracaṇḍā pātu vāyavye kauberyām ghorarūpiṇī
translated: May Prachanda protect my northwest direction, and Ghorarupini my northeast direction.

original: īśvarī ca tathaiśānyāṃ pātu nityaṃ sanātanī /
analyzed: īśvarī ca tathā aiśānyām pātu nityam sanātanī
translated: May the eternal Ishvari always protect my northeast direction.

analyzed: ūrdhvam pātu mahāmāyā pātu adhas parameśvarī
translated: May the great Maya protect from above, and the supreme Goddess protect from below.

original: agrataḥ pātu māmugrā pṛṣṭhato vaiṣṇavī tathā /
analyzed: agratas pātu mām ugrā pṛṣṭhatas vaiṣṇavī tathā
translated: May the fierce one protect me from the front, and the Vaishnavi from the back.

original: brahmāṇī dakṣiṇe pārśve nityaṃ rakṣatu śobhanā // //
analyzed: brahmāṇī dakṣiṇe pārśve nityam rakṣatu śobhanā  /
translated: May the auspicious Brahmani always protect the right side.
May the Mahesvari, marked with the bull, always protect the left side.

original: kaumārī parvate pātu vārāhī salile ca mām // //
analyzed: kaumārī parvate pātu vārāhī salile ca mām  /
translated: May the Kumari protect on the mountain, and the Varahi protect me in the water.

original: nārasiṃhī daṃṣṭibhaye pātu māṃ vipineṣu ca /
analyzed: nārasiṃhī daṃṣṭi bhaye pātu mām vipineṣu ca
translated: May the Narasimhi protect from the fear of fangs and in the forests.

original: aindrī māṃ pātu cākāśe tathā sarvajale sthale // //🔽setuḥ sarvāṅgulīḥ pātu devādiḥ pātu karṇayoḥ /
analyzed: aindrī mām pātu ca ākāśe tathā sarva jale sthale  setuḥ sarva aṅgulīḥ pātu deva ādiḥ pātu karṇayoḥ
translated: May the Aindri protect me in the sky, and likewise in all water and on land.🔽May the Setu protect all the fingers, and the Devadi protect the ears.

analyzed: devāntaḥ cibuke pātu pārśvayoḥ śakti pañcamaḥ
translated: May the Devamanta protect the chin, and the Shaktipanchama the sides.

original: hā pātu māṃ tathaivorvormāyā rakṣatu jaṅghayoḥ /
analyzed: hā pātu mām tathā evā ūrvoḥ māyā rakṣatu jaṅghayoḥ
translated: May the Ha always protect me, and likewise Maya protect the thighs.

analyzed: sarva aindriyāṇi yaḥ pātu romakūpeṣu arvadā
translated: May the one who protects all the senses always protect in the pores of the hair.

original: tvaci māṃ vai sadā pātu māṃ śambhuḥ pātu sarvadā /
analyzed: tvaci mām vai sadā pātu mām śambhuḥ pātu sarvadā
translated: May the skin always protect me, and may Shambhu always protect me.

original: nakhadantakaroṣṭhādau rā māṃ pātu sadaiva hi // //
analyzed: nakha danta kara uṣṭha ādau rāḥ mām pātu sadā eva hi
translated: May the Ra always protect me in the nails, teeth, lips, etc.

original: devādiḥ pātu māṃ vastau devāntaḥ stanakakṣayoḥ /
analyzed: devādiḥ pātu mām vastau devāntaḥ stana kakṣayoḥ
translated: May the Devadi protect me in the anus, and the Devamanta in the breasts and armpits.

original: etadādau tu yaḥ seturbāhye māṃ pātu dehataḥ // //🔽ājñācakre suṣamnāyāṃ ṣaṭcakre hṛdi sandhiṣu /
analyzed: etad ādau tu yaḥ setuḥ bāhye mām pātu dehataḥ  / ājñācakre suṣamnāyām ṣaṭcakre hṛdi sandhiṣu
translated: May this, the first bridge, protect me externally from the body.🔽In the cakra of the forehead, in the Suṣumnā, in the six cakras, in the heart, in the joints,

analyzed: ādiṣoḍaśacakre ca lalāṭa ākāśe eva ca
translated: In the sixteen primary cakras, and in the space of the forehead.

original: vaiṣṇavī tantramantro māṃ nityaṃ rakṣaṃśca tiṣṭhatu /
analyzed: vaiṣṇavī tantra mantraḥ mām nityam rakṣan ca tiṣṭhatu
translated: May the mantra of the Vaiṣṇavī Tantra always protect me and remain.

analyzed: arṇa nāḍīṣu sarvāsu pārśva kakṣa śikhāsu ca
translated: In all the veins and channels, in the sides, armpits, and crests,

analyzed: rudhira snāyu majjāsu mastiṣkeṣu ca parvasu
translated: In the blood, sinews, marrow, brains, and joints,

analyzed: dvitīya aṣṭa akṣaraḥ mantraḥ kavacam pātu sarvatas
translated: The second mantra of eight syllables, may the armor protect me from all sides.

analyzed: retaḥ vāyau nābhi randhre pṛṣṭha sandhiṣu sarvatas
translated: In the semen, in the navel aperture, in the back joints, everywhere,

analyzed: ṣaṣ akṣaraḥ tṛtīyaḥ yam mantraḥ mām pātu sarvadā
translated: This third mantra of six syllables, may it always protect me.

analyzed: nāsā randhre mahāmāyā kaṇṭha randhre tu vaiṣṇavī
translated: In the nostrils, Mahāmāyā, in the throat aperture, Vaiṣṇavī,

original: yasmin karmaṇi yoddiṣṭo mantrarpūjāsu bhairava // //🔽naivedyālokamantreṇa tat tat karma samācaret /
analyzed: yasmin karmaṇi yaḥ uddiṣṭaḥ bhairava  naivedya āloka mantreṇa tat tat karma samācaret
translated: O Bhairava, in whatever action a mantra is prescribed for worship,🔽one should perform that action with the mantra of offering.

analyzed: devyāḥ tu maṇḍala nyāsam iṣṭa mantreṇa ca ācaret  /
translated: One should perform the arrangement of the Goddess's mandala with the desired mantra.

original: pūjānte maṇḍalaṃ liptvā tilakaṃ tena kārayet /
analyzed: pūjā ante maṇḍalam liptvā tilakam tena kārayet
translated: At the end of the worship, having smeared the mandala, one should make a tilaka with it,

analyzed: sarva vaśyena mantreṇa dharma kāma artha dāyinā
translated: with the mantra that grants Dharma, desire, and wealth.

original: balidāne baliṃ chitvā khaḍgasthai rudhiraiḥ svakaiḥ /
analyzed: bali dāne balim chitvā khaḍga sthaiḥ rudhiraiḥ svakaiḥ
translated: In the offering of oblations, having cut the oblation with one's own blood from the sword,

analyzed: sarva vaśyena mantreṇa lalāṭe tilakam nyaset
translated: With the mantra Sarvavasya, one should apply a tilaka on the forehead.

original: jagadvaśe bhavet tasya caturthaḥ kasya vahninā /
analyzed: jagat vaśe bhavet tasya caturthaḥ kasya vahninā
translated: The world will be under his control, the fourth by the fire of whom.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha svareṇa saṃyuktaḥ kalā bindu samanvitaḥ
translated: Conjoined with the sixth vowel, endowed with the digit and the point.

analyzed: atha upānta sthakāra antar tathā punar
translated: Then again, the one ending with the penultimate letter, along with the anusvara,

analyzed: dvirmohī iti akāra asya turyaḥ dvi svara saṃyutaḥ  tṛtīya varga prāntena tṛtīya svara saṃjñinā
translated: Twice mohi, and the letter a with the fourth, conjoined with the double vowel.🔽Filled with the one designated as the third vowel, which is at the end of the third class,

analyzed: pūrita antaḥ vidhā varṇaḥ tathā ādi caturthakaḥ
translated: The syllable vi, and likewise the first of the fourth,

original: svaro dvitīyaśca tathā kṣobhaśabdaḥ puraḥ saraḥ /
analyzed: svaraḥ dvitīyaḥ ca tathā kṣobha śabdaḥ puras saraḥ
translated: The second vowel, and likewise the word kṣobha at the beginning,

original: pureti sahitaḥ so'pi mitr'm śatruśca rākṣasaḥ // //
analyzed: purā iti sahitaḥ saḥ api śatruḥ ca rākṣasaḥ
translated: Along with the word pura, and that one also along with iti, mitra, śatru, and rāksasa.

original: akṣaprajā tathā rājā sarvaśāstra iti śrutaḥ /
analyzed: akṣa prajā tathā rājā sarva śāstraḥ iti śrutaḥ
translated: Aksa, prajā, and likewise rājan, known as sarvaśāstra,

original: vināpi pūjanaṃ kuryād yo rahastilakaṃ naraḥ // //
analyzed: vinā api pūjanam kuryāt yaḥ rahaḥ tilakam naraḥ
translated: Even without worship, a man who always applies the tilaka with this mantra,

original: mantreṇānena satataṃ sarvaṃ tasya vaśe bhavet /
analyzed: mantreṇa anena satatam sarvam tasya vaśe bhavet
translated: Everything will be under his control.

original: rājā vā rājaputro vā striyo vā yakṣarākṣasāḥ // //
analyzed: rājā vā rāja putraḥ vā striyaḥ vā yakṣa rākṣasāḥ
translated: Whether a king or a prince, women or yakshas and rakshasas,

analyzed: sarve tasya vaśam yānti bhūta grāmāḥ caturvidhāḥ
translated: All of them come under his control, as well as the four types of elemental beings.

original: pravāse pathi vā durge sthānāprāptau jale'pi vā // //
analyzed: pravāse pathi vā durge sthāna aprāptau jale pi vā
translated: while traveling, on a difficult path, in a difficult situation, when not reaching a place, or even in water,

analyzed: kārā āgāre nibaddhaḥ vā vā
translated: while bound in prison, or even while in the king's house,

original: kuryāt tatra mahāmāyāpūjāṃ vai mānasīṃ budhaḥ // //
analyzed: kuryāt tatra mahāmāyā pūjām vai mānasīm budhaḥ
translated: the wise one should perform the mental worship of Mahāmāyā there.

analyzed: anobhaye samutpanne siṃha vyāghra samākule
translated: when both are arisen, when crowded with lions and tigers,

analyzed: para cakra āgame vā api kuryāt mānasa pūjanam
translated: or when the army of enemies arrives, one should perform the mental worship.

analyzed: manasā hṛdayasya antar dhyātvā yoga ākhya pīṭhakam
translated: having meditated in the mind, in the heart, on the seat called yoga,

analyzed: tatra eva pṛthivī madhye pūjām tatra samācaret
translated: in the middle of the earth itself, one should perform the worship there.

analyzed: maitram prasādhanam snānam dantadhāvana karma vai
translated: the friendly preparation, bathing, and the act of brushing the teeth,

original: anyacca sarvaṃ manasā kṛtvā kuryācca pūjanam // //
analyzed: anyat ca sarvam manasā kṛtvā kuryāt ca pūjanam
translated: and having done everything else mentally, one should perform the worship.

analyzed: puṣpa ādibhiḥ pūjā bahis deśe vidhīyate
translated: after that, the worship with flowers etc. is performed in an external place,

analyzed: tathā hṛdi api kartavyā sarvāḥ ca pratipattayaḥ
translated: and likewise, all the practices should be done in the heart.

original: aṣṭamyāṃ satataṃ devīyājakaḥ syāt sadā vratī /
analyzed: aṣṭamyām satatam devī yājakaḥ syāt sadā vratī
translated: one who worships the Goddess should always be a vow-holder on the eighth day,

original: navamyāṃ tu tathā pūjā kartavyā nijaśoṇitaiḥ // //
analyzed: navamyām tu tathā pūjā kartavyā nija śoṇitaiḥ
translated: and likewise, the worship should be done with one's own blood on the ninth day.

original: liṅgasthāṃ pūjayed devīṃ pustakasthāṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: liṅga sthām pūjayet devīm pustaka sthām tathā eva ca
translated: one should worship the Goddess residing in the Linga and likewise residing in the book,

analyzed: sthaṇḍila sthām mahāmāyām pādukā pratimāsu ca
translated: And the great illusion residing on the sacrificial ground, and in the images of sandals,

original: itre ca triśikhe khaḍgaṃ jalasthāṃ vāpi pūjayet /
analyzed: itre ca tri śikhe khaḍgam jala sthām vā api pūjayet
translated: And in the sword with three edges, or one should worship her residing in water.

analyzed: pañcāśat aṅgulam khaḍgam tri śikham ca triśūlakam
translated: The sword should be fifty fingers long, and the trident with three edges,

analyzed: śilāyām parvatasya agre tathā parvata gahvare
translated: On a stone, on the top of a mountain, and likewise in the cave of a mountain,

analyzed: devīm sampūjayet nityam bhakti śraddhā samanvitaḥ
translated: One should always worship the Goddess, endowed with devotion and faith.

original: vārāṇasyāṃ sadā pūjā sampūrṇaphaladāyinī /🔽tatastaddviguṇā proktā puruṣottamasannidhau // //
analyzed: vārāṇasyām sadā pūjā sampūrṇa phala dāyinī  tatas tad dviguṇā proktā puruṣottama sannidhau
translated: In Vārāṇasī, the worship always bestows the complete fruit.🔽Then, it is said to be twice as effective in the vicinity of Puruṣottama.

analyzed: tatas api dviguṇā proktā dvārāvatyām viśeṣataḥ
translated: Then, it is said to be twice as effective in Dvārakā, especially.

analyzed: sarva kṣetreṣu tīrtheṣu pūjā dvārāvatī samā
translated: The worship is equal to that of Dvārakā in all the holy places and sacred fords.

analyzed: vindhye śataguṇā proktā gaṅgāyām api tad samā
translated: In the Vindhya region, it is said to be a hundred times effective, and likewise in the Ganges.

analyzed: āryāvarte madhyadeśe brahmāvarte tathā eva ca
translated: In Āryāvarta, Madhyadeśa, and likewise in Brahmapurī,

original: vindhyavat phaladā pūjā prayāge puṣkare tathā /
analyzed: vindhya vat phala dā pūjā prayāge puṣkare tathā
translated: The worship gives fruit like the Vindhya region, and likewise in Prayāga and Puṣkara.

original: tataścaturguṇā proktā karatoyā nadījale // //🔽tasmāccaturguṇaphalā nandikuṇḍe ca bhairava /
analyzed: tatas caturguṇā proktā karatoyā nadī jale 🔽tasmāt caturguṇa phalā nandikuṇḍe ca bhairava
translated: Then, it is said to be four times effective in the water of the Karatoyā river.🔽O Bhairava, the fruit is four times greater than that in the Nandikuṇḍa.

analyzed: tatas caturguṇā proktā jalpi sebha īśvara sannidhau
translated: Then, it is said to be four times greater in the presence of Jalphisesha.

analyzed: tatra siddheśvarī yonau dviguṇā smṛtā
translated: There, in the womb of Siddheshvari, it is remembered to be twice as much.

analyzed: tatas caturguṇā proktā lohitya nada pāthasi
translated: Then, it is said to be four times greater in the waters of the Lohitya River.

original: tatsamā kāmarūpe tu sarvatraiva jale sthale /
analyzed: tad samā kāmarūpe tu sarvatra eva jale sthale
translated: That much is in Kamrupa everywhere, on land and in water.

analyzed: sarva śreṣṭhaḥ yathā viṣṇuḥ lakṣmīḥ sarva uttamā yathā
translated: Just as Vishnu is the best of all, and Lakshmi is the best of all,

original: devīpūjā tathā śastā kāmarūpe surālaye /🔽devīkṣetraṃ kāmarūpaṃ vidyate'nyatra tatatsamam // //
analyzed: devī pūjā tathā śastā kāmarūpe surālaye  devī kṣetram kāmarūpam vidyate nyatra
translated: Similarly, the worship of the Goddess is recommended in Kamrupa, the abode of the gods.🔽The Goddess's field, Kamrupa, exists elsewhere, but it is not equal to that.

original: anyatra viralā devī kāmarūpe gṛhe gṛhe /
analyzed: anyatra viralā devī kāmarūpe gṛhe gṛhe
translated: Elsewhere, the Goddess is rare, but in Kamrupa, she is in every house.

original: tataḥ śataguṇā proktā nīlakūṭasya mastake // //🔽tato'pi dviguṇā proktā eruke śivaliṅgake /
analyzed: tatas śataguṇā proktā nīlakūṭasya mastake  dviguṇā proktā eruke śiva liṅgake
translated: Therefore, it is said to be a hundred times greater on the peak of Nilakuta.🔽Then, it is said to be twice as much in the Shiva linga of Eruka.

analyzed: tatas api dviguṇā proktā śailaputrī ādi yoniṣu
translated: Then, it is said to be twice as much in the wombs of the daughter of the mountain and others.

analyzed: tatas śataguṇā proktā kāma ākhyā yoni maṇḍale
translated: Then, it is said to be a hundred times greater in the mandala of the womb of Kamakhya.

analyzed: kāma ākhyāyām mahāmāyā pūjām yaḥ kṛtavān sakṛt
translated: He who has performed the worship of the great Maya Kamakhya even once,

original: sa ceha labhate kāmān paratra śivarūpatām /
analyzed: sa ca iha labhate kāmān paratra śiva rūpa tām
translated: He obtains desires in this world and the form of Shiva in the next.

original: na tasya sadṛśo'nyo'sti kṛtyaṃ tasya na vidyate // //
analyzed: na tasya sadṛśaḥ ūnyaḥ asti kṛtyam tasya na vidyate
translated: There is no one equal to him, and no task of his remains undone.

analyzed: vāñchita artham avāpya iha cira āyuḥ abhijāyate
translated: Having obtained the desired object here, he becomes long-lived.

analyzed: vāyoḥ iva gatiḥ tasya bhavet anyaiḥ abādhitā
translated: His movement becomes unobstructed by others, like that of the wind.

original: saṅgrāme śāstravāde vā durjayaḥ sa ca jāyate /
analyzed: saṅgrāme śāstra vāde vā durjayaḥ sa ca jāyate
translated: He becomes invincible in battle or in debate on scriptures.
By the mantra of the Vaishnava Tantra, in the Yoni Mandala of Kamakhya,

original: sakṛt tu pūjanaṃ kṛtvā phalaṃ śataguṇaṃ labhet // //
analyzed: sakṛt tu pūjanam kṛtvā phalam śataguṇam labhet  /
translated: Having worshipped only once, one obtains a hundred times the fruit.

analyzed: mūlamūrtiḥ mahāmāyā yoganindrā jagat mayī
translated: The root form is the great Maya, the sleep of Yoga, the essence of the universe.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu vaiṣṇavītantram mantram prāk pratipāditam
translated: The mantra of that Vaishnava Tantra has been taught earlier.

analyzed: anyāḥ yāḥ mūrtayaḥ proktā śailaputrī ādayaḥ uparāḥ
translated: The other forms mentioned, such as the daughter of the mountain and others,

analyzed: tasyāḥ eva vibhāgāḥ tāḥ tad śarīra vinirgatāḥ
translated: Are the divisions of that itself, emanating from her body.

analyzed: niḥsaranti yathā nityam sūrya bimbāt marīcayaḥ
translated: Just as rays constantly emerge from the orb of the sun,

analyzed: devyāḥ tathā ugracaṇḍa ādyāḥ mahāmāyā śarīrataḥ
translated: So do Ugra, Chanda, and others from the body of the great Maya.

analyzed: tāsām eva aṅga rūpāṇi vaktavyāni mayā tava
translated: I must tell you about the forms of their limbs.

original: ekaiva tu mahāmāyā kāryārthaṃ bhinnatāṃ gatā // //
analyzed: ekā eva tu mahāmāyā kārya artham bhinna tām gatā
translated: But the great Maya is one only, divided for the sake of action.

analyzed: kāma ākhyā tu mahāmāyā mūlamūrtiḥ pragīyate
translated: Kamakhya, the great Maya, is sung as the root form.

analyzed: pīṭhaiḥ bhinna āhvayā sā tu mahāmāyā pragīyate
translated: She, the great Maya, is sung as having different names due to the different seats.

original: ka eva yathā viṣṇurnityatvād hi sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ eva yathā viṣṇuḥ nitya tvāt hi sanātanaḥ
translated: Who is like Vishnu, who is eternal because of His eternity?

analyzed: janānām ardanāt saḥ api janārdanaḥ iti śrutaḥ
translated: He is also known as Janardana because He crushes the people.

original: tathaiva sā mahāmāyā kāmārtha saṅgatā girau /
analyzed: tathā eva sā mahāmāyā kāma artha saṅgatā girau
translated: In the same way, that great Maya, united with Kama and Artha on the mountain,

analyzed: kāmākhyā iti sadā devaiḥ gadyate satatam naraiḥ
translated: is always called by the gods and men as Kamakhya.

original: yathā hi puruṣaḥ ko'pi cchatro cchatragrahād bhavet /
analyzed: yathā hi puruṣaḥ kaḥ api chatro chatra grahāt bhavet
translated: Just as a certain man becomes an umbrella-holder because of holding an umbrella,

analyzed: snāpakaḥ snāna kāle vai kāmākhyā api tathā āhvayā
translated: and a bather at the time of bathing, so is Kamakhya also called.

analyzed: mahāmāyā śarīram tu kāma artham samupasthitam
translated: The body of Mahamaya, present for the sake of Kama and Artha,

analyzed: lohitaiḥ kuṅkumaiḥ pītam kāma artham upayojitaiḥ
translated: is bathed with red, saffron and yellow substances used for the sake of Kama and Artha.

original: khaḍgaṃ tyaktvā kāmakāle sā gṛhṇāti srajaṃ svayam /
analyzed: khaḍgam tyaktvā kāma kāle sā gṛhṇāti srajam svayam
translated: She, having abandoned the sword at the time of love, herself takes up the garland.

original: yadā tu tyaktakāmā sā tadā syādasidhāriṇī // //🔽kāmakāle śivaprete nyastalohitapaṅkaje /
analyzed: yadā tu tyakta kāmā sā tadā syāt asi dhāriṇī  kāma kāle śiva prete nyasta lohita paṅkaje
translated: But when she has abandoned love, then she would be holding a sword.🔽At the time of love, when Shiva is present, with the red lotus placed,

analyzed: amate tyakta kāmā tu sita preta upari sthitā
translated: when love is abandoned, she is seated on a white corpse.

original: tathaivetastato gatyā siṃhasthā kāmadā bhavet /🔽kadācit sā sitaprete kadācidraktapaṅkaje // //
analyzed: tathā evā itas tatas gatyā siṃha sthā kāma dā bhavet  kadācid sā sita prete kadācid rakta paṅkaje  /
translated: In the same way, moving here and there, she would be the giver of love, seated on a lion.🔽Sometimes she is on a white corpse, sometimes on a red lotus.

analyzed: kadācid keśarī pṛṣṭhe ramate kāmarupiṇī
translated: Sometimes she sports on the back of a lion, assuming a form of love.

analyzed: yadā lohitapadma sthāḥ atha agre keśarī caraḥ  /
translated: When she is in the red lotus, then one should meditate on the lion in front.

analyzed: yadā preta gatā devī tadā agrenyam nirīkṣate
translated: When the goddess is in the preta state, then one should look at another in front.

analyzed: mahāmāyā sva rūpeṇa yadā sā vara dā bhavet
translated: When she becomes the bestower of boons in the form of Mahāmāyā,

original: pūjākāle tadā pretapadmasiṃhopari sthitā /🔽raktapadme yadā dhyāyet tadāgre cintayeddharim // //
analyzed: pūjā kāle tadā preta padma siṃha upari sthitā  rakta padme yadā dhyāyet tadā agre cintayet harim
translated: then at the time of worship, she is seated on the preta, lotus and lion.🔽When one meditates on the red lotus, then one should think of Hari in front.

analyzed: yadā dhyāyet harau ca anya dvayam agre vicintayet
translated: When one meditates on Hari, one should think of another in front.

analyzed: triṣu dhyāteṣu yugapad preta padma harau kramāt
translated: When the three are meditated upon simultaneously, then the preta, lotus and Hari are in order,

original: sthiteṣu kāmadā devī teṣu hyāyeta kāmadām /
analyzed: sthiteṣu kāma dā devī teṣu hi āyeta kāma dām
translated: and when they are present, the goddess who grants desires should meditate on her who grants desires.

analyzed: ekaikasmin api tathā yathā avacchintayet śivām
translated: In each one also, one should meditate on the auspicious one as appropriate.

original: ekā samastā jagatāṃ prakṛtiḥ sā yatastataḥ /
analyzed: ekā samastā jagatām prakṛtiḥ sā yatas tatas
translated: Since she is the one and the universal nature of the worlds,

analyzed: viṣṇu brahma śivaiḥ devaiḥ dhriyate sā jagat mayī
translated: she is sustained by the gods Viṣṇu, Brahmā and Śiva, and she is the one who pervades the world.
The great preta is Mahādeva, the red lotus is Brahmā,

analyzed: hariḥ hariḥ tu vijñeyaḥ vāhanāni mahā ojasaḥ
translated: and Hari is known as Hari. The vehicles are of great splendor.

original: svamūrtyā vāhanatvaṃ tu teṣāṃ yasmānna yujyate /
analyzed: sva mūrtyāḥ vāhana tvam tu teṣām yasmāt na yujyate
translated: Since it is not proper for them to be vehicles in their own forms,

analyzed: tasmāt mūrti antaram kṛtvā vāhana tvam gatāḥ trayaḥ
translated: therefore, having assumed another form, the three have become vehicles.

original: yasmin yasmin mahāmāyā prīṇāti satataṃ śivā /
analyzed: yasmin yasmin mahāmāyā prīṇāti satatam śivā
translated: In which, which great illusion, Shiva is always pleased,

analyzed: tena tena eva rūpeṇa āsanāni abhavan trayaḥ
translated: By that very form, the seats became three.

original: siṃhopari sthitaṃ padmaṃ raktaṃ tasyordhvagaḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: siṃha upari sthitam padmam raktam tasya ūrdhva gaḥ śivaḥ
translated: The lotus, red, is situated on the lion, above it is Shiva.

analyzed: tasya upari mahāmāyā vara dā abhaya dāyinī   /
translated: Above it is the great illusion, bestowing boons and protection.

original: evaṃ rūpeṇa yo dhyātvā pūjayet satataṃ śivām /
analyzed: evam rūpeṇa yaḥ dhyātvā pūjayet satatam śivām
translated: One who, having meditated on Shiva in this form, worships her always,

analyzed: brahma viṣṇu śivāḥ tena pūjitāḥ syuḥ asaṃśayam
translated: By him Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva are undoubtedly worshipped.

analyzed: evam sadā mahāmāyā kāma ākhyā ca eka rūpiṇī
translated: Thus, the great illusion is always of one form with Kamakhya.

original: dhyānato rūpato bhinnā tasmāttāṃ tatra pūjayet // //
analyzed: dhyānataḥ rūpataḥ bhinnā tasmāt tām tatra pūjayet  /
translated: She is different in meditation and form, therefore one should worship her there.

analyzed: evam viśeṣa tantrāṇi durgāyāḥ kathitāni vām
translated: Thus, the special Tantras of Durga have been told to you both.

analyzed: aṅga mantrāṇi tasyāḥ tu śrūyatām ara sattamau
translated: O best of men, may the limb mantras of her be heard.🔽Thus ends the fifty-ninth chapter in the Kalika Purana - 1.

analyzed: iti śrī kālikāpurāṇe ṣṭapañcāśaḥ adhyāyaḥ  ekonaṣaṣṭitamaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Chapter 69

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

analyzed: aṅgamantrāṇi aham vakṣye caṇḍikāyāḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: I shall tell the limb mantras of Chandिका in particular,

analyzed: yaiḥ samārādhitā devī caturvarga pradā bhavet
translated: By which the Goddess, when propitiated, would bestow the four goals of life.

analyzed: tāla vyāntaḥ yutaḥ ṣaṣṭha svara bindu indu vahnibhiḥ
translated: The letter Ṭ preceded by ṇ, combined with the sixth vowel, Bindu, crescent moon and fire,

original: tathopāntaḥ svarastvete bāhyaṃ vāgbhavameva ca // //🔽netrabījaṃ caṇḍikāyāstrayametat prakīrtitam /
analyzed: tathā upāntaḥ svaraḥ tu ete bāhyam vāc bhavam eva ca
translated: The vowel a at the end, and these are the external vag bhava (vagisvara).🔽The seed syllable of the eye of Chandika, this triad is proclaimed.

analyzed: vāma lalāṭa dākṣiṇya netreṣu tritayam kramāt
translated: In the left, forehead, and right eyes, the three in order.

translated: Madhuparka, bathing water, clothes, sandalwood, ornaments,🔽Flowers, incense, lamp, collyrium for the eyes,

analyzed: naivedya ācamanīye ca pradakṣiṇa namaskṛtī
translated: Food offerings, water for sipping, circumambulation, and prostrations,

analyzed: ete ṣoḍaśa nirdiṣṭāḥ upacārāḥ tu pīṭhataḥ
translated: These sixteen are prescribed as services from the seat.

analyzed: āvāhayet mahādevīm gāyatryā kāma yogayā
translated: One should invoke the Great Goddess with the Gāyatrī mantra of Kāma Yoga,

analyzed: tām eva viddhi vetāla guhyam bhairava daivatam
translated: Know that very same (goddess) to be the secret deity of Bhairava, O Vetāla.

analyzed: kāmākhye tvam iha āgaccha yathāvat mama sannidhau
translated: Come here to the one called Kāma, in my presence, as you are.

analyzed: pūjā karaṇi sānnidhyam iha kalpaya kāmini
translated: O Lover, create the presence here for the performance of worship.

original: kāmākhyāyai ca vidmahe kāmeśvaryai tu dhīmahi /
analyzed: kāmākhyāyai ca vidmahe kāmeśvaryai tu dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the goddess Kāmeśvarī, the one called Kāma.

analyzed: tatas kuryāt mahādevī tatas ca anu pracodayāt
translated: Then the great goddess should be worshipped, and then one should be urged to act.

analyzed: eṣā tu kāmagāyatrī pūjayet anayā śubhām
translated: This is the Kāma Gāyatrī. One should worship the auspicious one with this.

analyzed: pūjā avasāne ca balīn devyāḥ prītyai nivedayet
translated: And at the end of the worship, one should offer oblations for the satisfaction of the goddess.

analyzed: rudrākṣa mālayā jāpyam ādāya eva samācaret
translated: Having taken up the recitation with a rosary of Rudrākṣas, one should perform it.

analyzed: tri akṣaraiḥ mūlamantrasya tridhā vṛttaḥ prapūjayet
translated: With the three-syllabled root mantra, repeated three times, one should worship.

original: kāmākhyāyāḥ ṣaḍaṅgāni āhvānānantare tathā /🔽vaiṣṇavītantramantrasya karāṅganyāsayośca ye // //
analyzed: kāma ākhyāyāḥ ṣaṣ aṅgāni āhvāna anantare tathā  vaiṣṇavītantra mantrasya kara aṅganyāsayoḥ ca ye
translated: The six limbs of Kāmeśvarī, and likewise after the invocation,🔽The vowels that are mentioned for the Nyāsa of the Karāṅgas (hand-parts) and Aṅgas (body-parts) of the mantra of the Vaiṣṇavī Tantra,

original: svarāḥ proktāstaiḥ svaraistu sārdhacandraiḥ sabindukaiḥ /🔽mūlamantrādyakṣarābhyāṃ yugapattu niyojitaiḥ // //
analyzed: svarāḥ proktāḥ taiḥ svaraiḥ tu sa ardhacandraiḥ sa bindukaiḥ  mūlamantra ādi akṣarābhyām yugapad tu niyojitaiḥ
translated: With those vowels along with the half-moon and the dot,🔽Conjoined simultaneously with the first syllables of the root mantra,

analyzed: kaniṣṭha ādi krameṇa eva hi aṅganyāsam samācaret
translated: One should perform the Nyāsa of the limbs in the order of the little finger and so on.

analyzed: aṅganyāsa karanyāsau kṛtvā paścāt tu sādhakaḥ  hṛd śiraḥ tu śikhā varma netra āsya udara pṛṣṭhataḥ
translated: Having performed the limb and hand nyasa, the aspirant should then🔽place the heart, head, tuft, armor, eyes, mouth, belly, back,

original: bāhvoḥ pāṇyorjaṅghayośca pādayoścāpi vinyaset // //🔽abhayaṃ varadaṃ hastamakṣamālāṃ ca sūtrakam /
analyzed: bāhvoḥ pāṇyoḥ jaṅghayoḥ ca pādayoḥ ca api vinyaset  abhayam vara dam hastam akṣamālām ca sūtrakam
translated: arms, hands, shanks, and feet.🔽He should worship the gesture of fearlessness, boon-granting, rosary, and thread,

analyzed: pūjayet śaśinam sūryam śiraḥ cāndra kalām tathā
translated: the moon, sun, head, and the lunar digit,

analyzed: raktapadmam śavam ca eva lauhityam brahmaputrakam
translated: the red lotus, corpse, Lohitya, Brahma's son,

original: manobhavāṃ śilāṃ tatra śaktisthāṃ śavamadhyataḥ // //🔽devyāḥ prapūjayedbhaktaḥ kāravālaṃ ca pārśvataḥ /
analyzed: manobhavām śilām tatra śakti sthām śava madhyatas  devyāḥ prapūjayet bhaktaḥ kāravālam ca pārśvatas
translated: the Manobhava stone there, in the middle of the corpse, established in Shakti,🔽the devotee should worship the goddess's side with the sword,

analyzed: pīṭha ādi devatāḥ tatra yajet kāmeśvarīm śubhām
translated: and there, the auspicious Kamesvari, the deities of the seat and so on.

analyzed: tripurām pūjayet madhye pīṭha pratyadhidevatām
translated: In the middle, he should worship Tripurasundari, the deity of the seat,

original: śāradāṃ ca mahotsāhāṃ madhya eva prapūjayet // //
analyzed: śāradām ca mahā utsāhām madhye eva prapūjayet
translated: and also the greatly enthusiastic Sharada in the middle itself.
The great goddess Chandeshvari, the bearer of the goddess's leftovers,

analyzed: yonimudrā samākhyātā kāmākhyā visarjane
translated: is said to be the Yoni mudra at the dismissal of Kamakhya.

analyzed: idam dravyam tu sindūra candana aguru kuṅkumaiḥ
translated: This substance is with vermilion, sandalwood, agaru, and saffron,

original: iti yo hi mayā prokto viśeṣaḥ paripūjane // //🔽ebhirviśeṣaiḥ sahitaṃ vaiṣṇavītantragocaram /
analyzed: iti yaḥ hi mayā proktaḥ viśeṣaḥ paripūjane  ebhiḥ viśeṣaiḥ sahitam vaiṣṇavītantra gocaram
translated: This is the distinction that has been stated by me regarding the special worship.

analyzed: sarvam kalpam samāsādya kāmākhyām paripūjayet  /
translated: Endowed with these distinctions, one should worship Kāmeśvarī after obtaining the entire ritual procedure pertaining to the Vaiṣṇavī Tantra.

analyzed: anena eva vidhānena kāmākhyām yaḥ tu pūjayet
translated: One who worships Kāmeśvarī in this very manner,

analyzed: manobhava guhā madhye sa yāti paramām gatim
translated: he attains the highest state in the middle of the cave of Manobhava (Kāmadeva).

original: brahmāṇī caṇḍikā raudrī gaurīndrāṇī tathaiva ca /
analyzed: brahmāṇī caṇḍikā raudrī gaurī indrāṇī tathā eva ca
translated: Brahmāṇī, Caṇḍikā, Raudrī, Gaurī, Indrāṇī,

original: kaumārī vaiṣṇavī durgā narasiṃhī ca kālikā // //
translated: Kaumārī, Vaiṣṇavī, Durgā, Narasiṃhī, and Kālikā,

original: cāmuṇḍā śivadūtī ca vārāhī kauśikī tathā /
analyzed: cāmuṇḍā śivadūtī ca vārāhī kauśikī tathā
translated: Cāmuṇḍā, Śivadūtī, Vārāhī, Kauśikī,
Māheśvarī, Śāṅkarī, Jayantī, and Sarvamaṅgalā,

original: kālī kapālinī medhā śivā śākambharī tathā /
translated: Kālī, Kapālinī, Medhā, Śivā, Śākaṃbharī,

original: bhīmā śāntā bhrāmarī ca rudrāṇī cāmbikā tathā // //
analyzed: bhīmā śāntā bhrāmarī ca rudrāṇī ca ambikā tathā
translated: Bhīmā, Śāntā, Bhramari, Rudrāṇī, and Ambikā,

original: kṣamā dhātrī tathā svāhā svadhāparṇā mahodarī /
analyzed: kṣamā dhātrī tathā svāhā svadhā aparṇā mahodarī
translated: Kṣamā, Dhātrī, Svāhā, Svadhā, Parṇā, Mahodari,

analyzed: ghorarūpā mahākālī bhadrakālī bhayaṅkarī  /
translated: Ghorarūpā, Mahākālī, Bhadrakālī, Bhayaṅkarī,
Kṣemakarī, Ugracaṇḍā, Caṇḍogrā, Caṇḍanāyikā,
Caṇḍā, Caṇḍavatī, Caṇḍī, Mahāmohā, Priyaṅkarī,

analyzed: devī balapramathinī tathā
translated: The goddesses Kalavikariṇī, Balapramathinī,
Madanoñma-thinī, and the goddess Sarvabhūtadamani,

original: umā tārā mahānidrā vijayā ca jayā tathā /
analyzed: umā tārā mahānidrā vijayā ca jayā tathā
translated: Umā, Tārā, Mahānidrā, Vijayā, and Jayā,

original: pūrvoktāḥ śailaputryādyā yoginyaṣṭau ca yāḥ kramāt // //
analyzed: pūrva uktāḥ śailaputrī ādyāḥ yoginī aṣṭau ca yāḥ kramāt
translated: And the eight yoginīs mentioned earlier, starting with the daughter of the mountain, in order,

analyzed: tābhiḥ ebhiḥ ca sahitāḥ catuḥṣaṣṭim ca yoginīḥ
translated: Together with these and the sixty-four yoginīs,

analyzed: pūjayet maṇḍalasya antar sarva kāma artha siddhaye
translated: One should worship within the maṇḍala for the accomplishment of all desired goals.

original: nānāvidhaṃ tu naivedyaṃ pānaṃ pāyasameva ca /
analyzed: nānāvidham tu naivedyam pānam pāyasam eva ca
translated: Various kinds of offerings, drinks, and milk pudding,

analyzed: modaka apūpa piṣṭa ādi devyai samyak pradāpayet
translated: Modakas, cakes, flour, and so on, one should properly offer to the Goddess.

original: evaṃ tu pūjayed devīṃ kāmākhyāṃ varadāyinīm /
analyzed: evam tu pūjayet devīm kāmākhyām vara dāyinīm
translated: Thus one should worship the Goddess Kāmākhyā, the bestower of boons,

original: bhaktiyukto naro yastu sarvān labhate priyān // //
analyzed: bhakti yuktaḥ naraḥ yaḥ tu sarvān labhate priyān
translated: The man who is endowed with devotion obtains all his beloved things.

original: mahotsāhā tu yā devī mahāmāyā tu sā smṛtā /
analyzed: mahotsāhā tu yā devī mahāmāyā tu sā smṛtā
translated: The Goddess who is of great enthusiasm is remembered as Mahāmāyā.

analyzed: vaiṣṇavītantra mantreṇa sā pūjyā yoni maṇḍale
translated: She should be worshipped in the Yoni maṇḍala with the mantra of the Vaiṣṇavī Tantra.

original: tadeva maṇḍalaṃ cāsya hyaṅganyāsaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: tat eva maṇḍalam ca asya hi aṅganyāsam tathā eva ca
translated: That is the same maṇḍala, and the aṅganyāsa is the same,

original: sā eva pūjāparyāye taddhyānaṃ saiva daivatā // //
analyzed: sā eva pūjā paryāye tad dhyānam sā eva daivatā
translated: That is the same in the sequence of worship, and that is the same meditation, that is the same deity.

original: tantraṃ tadevamuktaṃ tu tasmānnānyaṃ tu kiñcana /
analyzed: tantram tat evam uktam tu tasmāt na anyam tu kiñcana
translated: That Tantra is said to be the same, there is nothing else but that.

analyzed: maṇḍala ādi visṛṣṭi artham mahāmāyā mahā utsave
translated: For the sake of the creation of the mandala and other things, in the great festival of the great illusion.

original: yatproktaṃ tena tāṃ devīṃ mahotsāhāṃ tu maṇḍale /
analyzed: yat proktam tena tām devīm mahā utsāhām tu maṇḍale
translated: The goddess of great enthusiasm should be worshipped in the mandala with that.

analyzed: snāna pūrvam pūjayet tu madhu ājya ādibhiḥ āsavaiḥ
translated: She should be worshipped with bathing, honey, ghee, etc., and wine.

analyzed: śṛṇutam tripurā mūrteḥ kāmākhyāyāḥ prapūjanam
translated: Listen to the worship of the goddess Tripura, who is known as Kamakhya.

analyzed: etasyāḥ mūlamantram tu pūrvam uttara tantrake  /
translated: The root mantra of this goddess has been taught earlier in the Uttara Tantra.

analyzed: yuvayoḥ iṣṭayoḥ samyak kramāt tat pratipāditam
translated: For the sake of the two of you, it has been properly imparted in due order.

original: vāgbhavaṃ kāmabījaṃ tu ḍāmaraṃ ceti tattrayam // //
analyzed: vāgbhavam kāmabījam tu ḍāmaram ca iti tat trayam
translated: The three are Vāgbhava, the seed of desire, and Ḍāmara.

analyzed: sarva dharma atha kāma ādi sādhakam kuṇḍalī yutam
translated: It is endowed with Kuṇḍalī, the accomplisher of all goals, desires, etc.

original: trīṇyasmāt purato dadyād durgā dhyātā maheśvarī // //
analyzed: trīṇi asmāt puratas dadyāt durgā dhyātā maheśvarī
translated: The great goddess Durgā should be meditated upon, with these three in front.

analyzed: tripurā iti tatas khyātā kāma ākhyā kāmarūpiṇī
translated: She is then known as Tripura, Kāmakhyā, who assumes the form of desire.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu snāpanam yādṛś kāmākhyāyāḥ prakīrtitam
translated: The bathing of that Kāmakhyā has been declared.

original: tenaiva snāpanaṃ kuryānmūlamantreṇa pūjakaḥ /🔽rikoṇaṃ maṇḍalaṃ cāsyāstripuraṃ tu trirekhakam // //
analyzed: tena eva snāpanam kuryāt mūlamantreṇa pūjakaḥ  rikoṇam maṇḍalam ca asyāḥ tripuram tu tri rekhakam
translated: The worshipper should perform the bathing with that very root mantra.🔽Her mandala is triangular, Tripura, with three lines.

original: mantraṃ tu akṣaraṃ jñeyaṃ tathā rūpaṃ trayaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: mantram tu akṣaram jñeyam tathā rūpam trayam punar
translated: The mantra should be known as akṣara, and the form as threefold again.

analyzed: trividhā kuṇḍalī śaktiḥ tri devānām ca sṛṣṭaye
translated: The Kundalini Shakti is of three types for the creation of the three gods.

original: sarvaṃ trayaṃ trayaṃ yasmāt tripurā tena sā smṛtā /
analyzed: sarvam trayam trayam yasmāt tripurā tena sā smṛtā
translated: Since all three are three, she is remembered as Tripura.

analyzed: udīcya ādi atha pūrva antāḥ rekhāḥ kāryāḥ tu maṇḍale
translated: In the north and east, lines should be drawn in the mandala.

analyzed: tris tri rekhāḥ tu kartavyāḥ tāḥ eva puṣpa candanaiḥ
translated: Those same lines should be made three times with flowers and sandal paste.

original: aiśānyamatha nairṛtyāṃ mantraṃ kṛtvā tu saṃlikhet // //
analyzed: aiśānyam atha nairṛtyām mantram kṛtvā tu saṃlikhet
translated: Having placed the mantra in the northeast and southwest, it should be written.

original: naiṛtyāṃ caiva vāyavyāṃ tato hyaiśānyagāṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: naiṛtyām ca eva vāyavyām tatas hi aiśānya gām punar
translated: In the southwest and northwest, and then in the northeast,

original: evaṃ trikoṇaṃ vilikhenmaṇḍalasyāntare punaḥ // //🔽iśānyādyāstu yā rekhā sā tu śaktirnigadyate /
analyzed: evam trikoṇam vilikhet maṇḍalasya antare punar  iśānī ādyāḥ tu yā rekhā sā tu śaktiḥ nigadyate
translated: thus a triangle should be drawn again inside the mandala.🔽The line starting from the northeast is said to be Shakti.

original: nairṛtyāṃ vāyavīṃ yātā tato hyaiśānyagā tu yā // //
analyzed: nairṛtyām vāyavīm yātā tatas hi aiśānya gā tu yā
translated: The one that goes from the southwest to the northwest and then to the northeast,

original: sā tu śambhuḥ samākhyātā śaktyā śambhuṃ vibhedayet /
analyzed: sā tu śambhuḥ samākhyātā śaktyā śambhum vibhedayet
translated: that is known as Shambhu. Shakti should be distinguished from Shambhu.

original: śaktyā vibhinnaṃ bhūteśaṃ veṣṭayet kamalena tu // //🔽aṣṭapatreṇa tāṃ dhyātvā trivarṇāṃ prāk prapūjayet /
analyzed: śaktyā vibhinnam bhūteśam veṣṭayet kamalena tu  aṣṭa patreṇa tām dhyātvā tri varṇām prāk prapūjayet
translated: The Lord of Beings, distinguished by Shakti, should be enveloped by a lotus.🔽Having meditated on her with three colors and eight petals, one should first worship.

original: tribhistribhistu rekhābhiḥ śaktiṃ śambhuṃ ca veṣṭayet // //
analyzed: tribhiḥ tribhiḥ tu rekhābhiḥ śaktim śambhum ca veṣṭayet  /
translated: Shakti and Shambhu should be enveloped with three lines each.

analyzed: sthānasya abhyukṣaṇam samyak ha mārjanam likhanam tathā
translated: The proper sprinkling of the place, sweeping, and drawing of lines,

analyzed: astra mantra prayogāṇām bhūtānām apasāraṇam
translated: And the application of mantras of weapons, and the removal of spirits,

analyzed: vaiṣṇavītantra mantra uktam tathā evā uttara tantrake
translated: As stated in the Vaishnava Tantra mantras, and likewise in the Uttara Tantra,

original: yat proktaṃ tat tu sāmānyaṃ prāk kuryāt sādhako naraḥ // //
analyzed: yat proktam tat tu sāmānyam prāk kuryāt sādhakaḥ naraḥ
translated: The practitioner, a man, should perform that in general beforehand.

analyzed: tripurāyāḥ viśeṣeṇa sahitam pūjana kramam
translated: The sequence of worship along with the special Tripuropasaka,

analyzed: etat trikoṇam devānām trayāṇām sthānam iṣyate  /
translated: This triangle is considered the abode of the three gods.

analyzed: aiśānyām tu tathā īśānaḥ nairṛtyām caturānanaḥ
translated: In the northeast, Ishana, in the southwest, the Four-faced One,

original: vāyavyāṃ tu tathā brahmā ṣaṭkoṇeṣu prakīrtitāḥ // //
analyzed: vāyavyām tu tathā brahmā ṣaṣ koṇeṣu prakīrtitāḥ
translated: And in the northwest, Brahma are proclaimed in the six corners.

original: dalaṃ tvekapuraṃ proktaṃ keśaraṃ cāparaṃ puram /🔽puraṃ śeṣaṃ trikoṇaṃ tu trikoṇaṃ maṇḍalaṃ smṛtam // //
analyzed: dalam tu ekapuram proktam keśaram ca aparam puram  puram śeṣam trikoṇam tu trikoṇam maṇḍalam smṛtam
translated: A petal is said to be one city, and the filament is another city.🔽The remaining city is the triangle, and the triangle is remembered as the mandala.

original: daleṣu keśare cāpi trikoṇe ca tridhā tridhā /
analyzed: daleṣu keśare ca api trikoṇe ca tridhā tridhā
translated: In the petals, filaments, and triangle, the lines are drawn in three ways each.

original: rekhāstu vihitāḥ samyak kuryāt tatra punaḥ punaḥ // //
analyzed: rekhāḥ tu vihitāḥ samyak kuryāt tatra punar punar
translated: The lines are properly drawn, and one should do that again and again.

original: uttaraṃ tad bhaved dvāraṃ tasya vai dhanurākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: uttaram tat bhavet dvāram tasya vai dhanuḥ ākṛtiḥ
translated: That would be the northern door, which has the shape of a bow.

original: pūrvadvāraṃ tu ṣaṭkoṇaṃ catuṣkoṇaṃ tu dakṣiṇe // //
analyzed: pūrva dvāram tu ṣaṭkoṇam catuṣkoṇam tu dakṣiṇe
translated: The eastern door is six-angled, and the southern one is four-angled.

analyzed: paścimam toraṇa ākāram yathā ca anyatra maṇḍale
translated: The western one should be shaped like a gate, just as in another mandala.

original: aiśānyāṃ pañcabāṇāṃstu likhed vahnau ca taddhanuḥ // //
analyzed: aiśānyām pañca bāṇān tu likhet vahnau ca tad dhanuḥ
translated: In the northeast, one should draw the five arrows, and in the southeast, the bow.

original: nairṛtyāṃ pustakaṃ cāpi vāyavyāmakṣamālikām /🔽evaṃ kṛtvā maṇḍalaṃ tu dhṛtvā vāmena pāṇinā // //
analyzed: nairṛtyām pustakam ca api vāyavyām akṣamālikām  evam kṛtvā maṇḍalam tu dhṛtvā vāmena pāṇinā
translated: In the southwest, a book, and in the northwest, a rosary.🔽Having thus created the mandala, holding it with the left hand,

original: vāgveśmane nama iti maṇḍalaṃ pūjayet tataḥ /
analyzed: vāgveśmane namaḥ iti maṇḍalam pūjayet tatas
translated: one should then worship the mandala with Salutations to the abode of speech.

analyzed: pūjayitvā tatas bhūtān nālikā tritayena tu
translated: Having worshipped, one should then expel the spirits with three hollow sounds,

analyzed: mūlamantreṇa pūrva uktaiḥ mantraiḥ api
translated: and with the root mantra and the previously mentioned mantras, one should perform the rite.

analyzed: navabhiḥ choṭikābhiḥ tu tridhā kṛtvā tu veṣṭanam
translated: Having made nine handfuls, dividing them into three parts,

analyzed: abhyukṣaṇam tatas kuryāt bhūtānām apasāraṇam
translated: one should then sprinkle them, expelling the spirits.

analyzed: pratipattiḥ tu pātrasya arghya artham navadhā punar
translated: The consecration of the vessel is again ninefold for the sake of the argha.

original: pūrvavat sādhakaḥ kuryād dahanaṃ plavanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: pūrvavat sādhakaḥ kuryāt dahanam plavanam tathā
translated: The adept should perform the burning and floating as before.

analyzed: amṛtīkaraṇam kuryāt prathamam dhenumudrayā
translated: One should first perform the consecration with the dhenumudrā.

original: yonimudrāṃ tataḥ kuryāt pātratoyaṃ tu triḥ spṛśet /
analyzed: yonimudrām tatas kuryāt pātra toyam tu tris spṛśet
translated: Then one should perform the yoni mudrā and touch the vessel water three times.

analyzed: mārtaṇḍa bhairavāya arghyam dūrvābhiḥ siddhasarṣapaiḥ
translated: The argha for Mārtaṇḍabhairava is with dūrvā grass and white mustard seeds.

original: raktapuṣpaiścandanaiśca sagaṇāya nivedayet /🔽pāṇikacchapikāṃ kṛtvā cintanaṃ yonimudrayā // //🔽ādau madhye ca kartavyaṃ kramād vetālabhairava /

translated: And bending the other fingers, it becomes the arrow; by extending them,

analyzed: iyam tu gaṇanāthasya prīti dā mudrikā uttamā
translated: This is the best mudra, which gives delight to the Lord of Calculation.

analyzed: dātṛ asi dhenu krakaca śaṃkulābhiḥ tu madhyamam
translated: while cutting with a knife, sword, cow's horn, or saw is medium.

analyzed: kṣura kṣura prabhallaiḥ ca parikīrtitam
translated: The offering is said to be made with sharp-edged weapons, razors, and spears.

analyzed: ebhyaḥ nyaḥ śakti bāṇa ādyaiḥ baliḥ chedyaḥ kadāpi na
translated: One should never offer oblations with other weapons such as arrows, etc.

original: nātti devī bali tattu dātā mṛtyumavāpnuyāt /
analyzed: na atti devī bali tat tu dātā mṛtyum avāpnuyāt
translated: The Goddess does not accept that oblation, and the giver would attain death.

original: hastena chedayed yastu prokṣita sādhakaḥ paśum // //
analyzed: hastena chedayet yaḥ tu prokṣita sādhakaḥ paśum
translated: If the adept cuts the animal with his hand, after consecrating it,

analyzed: akṣiṇam vā brahma vadhyām avāpnoti su duḥsahām
translated: he would incur the unbearable sin of Brahmanicide.

original: nāmantrya khaṇḍaṃ tu baliṃ niyuñjīta vicakṣaṇaḥ // //
analyzed: na āmantrya khaṇḍam tu balim niyuñjīta vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The wise one should employ the oblation without invoking the weapons.

analyzed: khaḍgasya āmantraṇe mantrāḥ yāvantaḥ kathitāḥ purā
translated: The mantras for invoking the sword, as many as have been mentioned before,

analyzed: mahāmāyā balau te vai yojyāḥ tatra uditāḥ budhaiḥ
translated: the mantras of Mahāmāyā and Balau, should be employed there by the wise.

analyzed: taiḥ sārdham ete mantrāḥ tu yojyāḥ khaḍga ādi mantraṇe
translated: Along with them, these mantras should be employed in invoking the sword and other weapons,

analyzed: pūjane śārada ādīnām kāmākhyāyāḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: in the worship of Śāradā and others, especially of Kāmākhyā.

original: dviḥ kālīti tato devyā vajreśvaripadaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: dvis kālī iti tatas devyāḥ vajreśvarī padam tatas
translated: Twice Kālī, then the word devī, then the word vajreśvarī,

original: tato'nu lauhadaṇḍāyai namaḥ śeṣe tu yojayet // //
analyzed: tatas nu lauhadaṇḍāyai namaḥ śeṣe tu yojayet  /
translated: then anulehaḍaṇḍāya, and at the end namaḥ should be added.

analyzed: sampūjya anena mantreṇa khaḍgam ādāya pāṇinā
translated: Having worshipped with this mantra, one should take up the sword with the hand,

analyzed: kālarātryāḥ tu mantreṇa tam khaḍgam abhimantrayet  /
translated: and should invoke that sword with the mantra of Kālarātri.

analyzed: netra bījasya madhyam tu dvis āvartya prayojayet
translated: Having repeated twice the middle seed of the eye, one should employ it.

analyzed: tatonu kāli kālī iti karāla uṣṭhī tatas parama
translated: Then after that, Kālikālī, Karālāsthī, and then after that,

analyzed: ha anta ādīn ca tṛtīyena svareṇa ekādaśena vai
translated: Having joined the letters ending with HA with the third, the eleventh vowel,

original: yojitā nādabindubhyāṃ dvau tat paścānniyojayet // //🔽phetkāriṇipadaṃ tasmāt khādayacchedayetyataḥ /
analyzed: yojitāḥ nādabindubhyām dvau tat paścāt niyojayet
translated: Endowed with Nāda and Bindu, one should then place two of them after that.

original: sarvān duṣṭāniti tato dvirmāraya lulāyakam // //🔽khaḍgena chindhi chindhīti tataḥ kilakileti vai /
analyzed: sarvān duṣṭān iti tatas dvis māraya lulāyakam  khaḍgena chindhi chindhi iti tatas kilakilā iti vai
translated: From that, the word Pheṭkāriṇī, Eat, cut, all the wicked ones, then kill twice, O Lūlāya,🔽 Cut with the sword, cut, then kilikili,

analyzed: tatas cikiciki iti evam tatas piba piba iti ca
translated: then chikichikī, thus, then drink, drink,

original: tato'nu rudhiraṃ ceti sphaiṃ sphaiṃkiri kirīti ca /
analyzed: tatas nu rudhiram ca iti sphaim sphaiṃkiri kiri iti ca
translated: then after that, blood, sphāṃ sphāṃ kīri kirī,

original: kālikāyai nama iti kāla rātryāstu mantrakam // //
analyzed: kālikāyai namaḥ iti kāla rātryāḥ tu mantrakam
translated: Salutations to Kālikā, this is the mantra of Kālarātri.

analyzed: iti anena tu mantreṇa
translated: By this mantra, when the knife is enchanted,

analyzed: kālarātrī svayam tatra prasīdati ari hānaye
translated: Kālarātri herself becomes pleased there for the destruction of enemies.

original: baleḥ pūrvoditā mantrā nityaṃ guhyāstu sādhakaiḥ /
analyzed: baleḥ pūrva uditāḥ mantrāḥ nityam guhyāḥ tu sādhakaiḥ
translated: The mantras mentioned earlier by Bali should always be kept secret by the practitioners.

analyzed: ayam mantraḥ tu vaktavyaḥ tasya hatyā vihānaye
translated: This mantra should be spoken for the destruction of his murder.

analyzed: yajña arthe paśavaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ svayam eva svayambhuvā
translated: Animals were created by the Self-Existent One himself for the purpose of sacrifices.

analyzed: atas tvām dhātayiṣyāmi tasmāt yajñe vadhaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: Therefore, I shall kill you. Therefore, killing in a sacrifice is not killing.

analyzed: tatas daivatam uddiśya kāmam uddiśya ca ātmanaḥ
translated: Then, with the deity in mind and one's own desire,

original: chedayet tena khaḍgena baliṃ pūrvānanaṃ tu tam // //
analyzed: chedayet tena khaḍgena balim pūrva ānanam tu tam
translated: one should cut with that sword, and that offering should face the east.

analyzed: athavā uttara vaktram tam svayam pūrva mukhaḥ tathā
translated: Or that one should face the north, and oneself the east.

original: pūrvoktān saindhavādīṃstu vakttre'vaśyaṃ niyojayet // //🔽sauvarṇaṃ rājata tāmraṃ raityaṃ patrapuṭa ca vā /🔽māheyaṃ kāṃsyamathavā yajñakāṣṭhamayaṃ ca vā // //
analyzed: pūrva uktān saindhava ādīn tu vakttrā evaśyam niyojayet  sauvarṇam tāmram raityam ca vā  māheyam kāṃsyam athavā yajña kāṣṭha mayam ca vā
translated: One should certainly employ the previously mentioned Saindhava etc. in the face.🔽A vessel for offering blood should be made according to one's means, whether golden, silver, copper, brass, leaf-cup,

analyzed: pātram rudhira dānāya kartavyam vibhava avadhi
translated: iron, bell-metal, or made of sacrificial wood.

original: na lauhe valkale vāpi vaitre rāṅge'tha saisake // //
analyzed: na lauhe valkale vā api vaitre saisake
translated: Not in an iron or bark vessel, nor in a bamboo or lead vessel.

original: dadyādraktaṃ balīnāṃ tu bhūmau sruci sruve tathā /
analyzed: dadyāt raktam balīnām tu bhūmau sruci sruve tathā
translated: One should offer blood to the powerful ones on the ground, in a ladle or sacrificial spoon.

original: na ghaṭe bhūtale vāpi deyaṃ kṣudre na bhājane // //
analyzed: na ghaṭe bhū tale vā api deyam kṣudre na bhājane
translated: Not in a pot or on the ground, it should not be given in a small vessel.

analyzed: rudhirāṇi pradadyāt tu bhūti kāmaḥ nara uttamaḥ
translated: A man desiring prosperity should offer blood.

original: narasya tu sadā raktaṃ māhaiye taijase'tha vā // //
analyzed: narasya tu sadā raktam vā
translated: The blood of a man should always be offered in an iron or gold vessel.

analyzed: dadyāt narapatiḥ tat tu na patra ādau kadācana
translated: The king should offer it, never on a leaf or such things.

analyzed: hayamedham ṛte dadyāt na kadācid hayam balim
translated: Except in the horse sacrifice, he should never offer a horse as a sacrificial animal.

analyzed: tathā dikpāla medhe tu gajam dadyāt narādhipaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the sacrificial session dedicated to the guardians of the directions, the king should offer an elephant.

analyzed: na kadācid tadā devyai pradadyāt haya hastinau
translated: Never at that time should he offer a horse or an elephant to the Goddess.

original: hayākarṣe cāmaraṃ tu baliṃ dadyānnarādhipaḥ /🔽siṃhaṃ vyāghraṃ naraṃ cāpi svagātrarudhiraṃ tathā // //
analyzed: haya ākarṣe cāmaram tu balim dadyāt narādhipaḥ  siṃham vyāghram naram ca api sva gātra rudhiram tathā
translated: In the horse-sacrifice, the king should offer a yak-tail as a sacrificial animal.🔽A Brahmin should never offer a lion, a tiger, a man, or his own blood to the Great Goddess.

original: na dadyāt brāhmaṇo madyaṃ mahādevyai kadācana /
analyzed: na dadyāt brāhmaṇaḥ madyam mahādevyai kadācana
translated: A Brahmin who offers wine to the Great Goddess would go to hell.

original: siṃhaṃ vyāghrannaraṃ datvā brāhmaṇo narakaṃ vrajet // //
analyzed: siṃham da tvā brāhmaṇaḥ narakam vrajet  /
translated: Having offered a lion, tiger, or man, a Brahmin would go to hell.

analyzed: iha api syāt sa hīna āyuḥ sukha saubhāgya varjitaḥ
translated: Even in this world, he would have a short life and be devoid of happiness and good fortune.

analyzed: sva gātra rudhiram dadyāt ca ātma vadhyām avāpnuyāt
translated: Offering his own blood, he would attain self-destruction.

analyzed: madyam dattvā brāhmaṇaḥ tu brāhmaṇyāt eva hīyate
translated: A Brahmin who offers wine would be deprived of his Brahmin status.

original: na kṛṣṇāsāraṃ vitared baliṃ tu kṣatriyādikaḥ // //
analyzed: na kṛṣṇā sāram vitaret balim tu kṣatriya ādikaḥ
translated: A Kshatriya and others should not offer a black antelope as a sacrificial animal.

original: dadataḥ kṛṣṇasāraṃ tu brahmahatyā bhaved yataḥ /
analyzed: dadataḥ kṛṣṇa sāram tu brahmahatyā bhavet yatas
translated: For by offering a black antelope, one would incur the sin of killing a Brahmin.

original: yatra siṃhasya vyāghrasya narasya vihito vadhaḥ // //
analyzed: yatra siṃhasya vyāghrasya narasya vihitaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: Where the killing of a lion, tiger, or man is prescribed,

original: brahmaṇoktā tu balyādau tatrāyaṃ vihitaḥ kramaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇā uktā tu bali ādau tatra ayam vihitaḥ kramaḥ
translated: In the Bali offering etc. mentioned by Brahma, this sequence is prescribed:

original: kṛtvā ghṛtamayaṃ vyāghraṃ naraṃ siṃhaṃ ca bhairava // //
analyzed: kṛtvā ghṛta mayam vyāghram naram siṃham ca bhairava
translated: O Bhairava, having made a tiger, a man, and a lion out of ghee,

analyzed: athavā pūpa vikṛtam yavakṣoda mayam ca vā
translated: Or else, made of dough, or of barley flour,

analyzed: ghātayet candahāsena tena mantreṇa saṃskṛtam
translated: And killed with the Chandhahase mantra, consecrated with that mantra,

original: prabhūtabalidāne tu dvau vā trīn vāgrataḥ kṛtān /
analyzed: prabhūta bali dāne tu dvau vā trīn vā agratas kṛtān
translated: In the offering of abundant Bali, two or three at the front,

original: pūjayet pramukhān kṛtvā sarvān mantreṇa sādhakaḥ // //
analyzed: pūjayet pramukhān kṛtvā sarvān mantreṇa sādhakaḥ
translated: The adept should worship all of them, having placed them at the front, with the mantra.

analyzed: sāmānya pūjā kathitā balīnām pūrvatas mayā
translated: The general worship of the Balis has been described by me before.

original: viśeṣo yatraḥ yatrāsti tanmattaḥ śṛṇu bhairava // //
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ yatra yatra asti tat mattaḥ śṛṇu bhairava
translated: Listen from me, O Bhairava, where there is a special (worship).

original: mahiṣaṃ pradaded devyai bhairavyai bhairavāya vā /
analyzed: mahiṣam pradadet devyai bhairavyai bhairavāya vā
translated: One should offer a buffalo to the Goddess, to Bhairavi or to Bhairava,

original: anenaiva tu mantreṇa tadā taṃ pūjayed balim // //
analyzed: anena eva tu mantreṇa tadā tam pūjayet balim  /
translated: And worship that Bali with this very mantra.

original: yathā vāhaṃ bhavān dveṣṭi yathā vahasi caṇḍikām /
analyzed: yathā vā aham bhavān dveṣṭi yathā vahasi caṇḍikām
translated: Just as you hate me, just as you carry Chandrika,

original: tathā mama ripūn hiṃsa śubhaṃ vaha lulāyaka // //🔽yamasya vāhanastvaṃ tu vararūpadharāvyaya /
analyzed: tathā mama ripūn hiṃsa śubham vaha lulāyaka  yamasya vāhanaḥ tvam tu vara rūpa dhara avyaya
translated: In the same way, O Lulaiaka, harm my enemies, carry auspiciousness.🔽You are the vehicle of Yama, of excellent form, imperishable,

original: āyurvittaṃ yaśo dehi kāsarāya namo'stu te // //
analyzed: āyuḥ vittam yaśaḥ dehi kāsarāya namaḥ astu te  /
translated: Grant me longevity, wealth, and fame, salutations to you, O Kasaraya (one who carries the dead).

original: khaḍgasya tu yadā dānaṃ kriyate tantramantrakam /
analyzed: khaḍgasya tu yadā dānam kriyate tantra mantrakam
translated: When the gift of a sword is being made, along with the Tantra mantra,

analyzed: jalena abhyukṣya kurvīta guhā jātā iti bhāṣayan
translated: Having sprinkled with water, one should make it, saying Born in the cave.

original: daive paitre ca śubhagaḥ khaḍgastvaṃ khaḍgasannibhaḥ /
analyzed: daive paitre ca śubhagaḥ khaḍgaḥ tvam khaḍga sannibhaḥ
translated: In the case of gods and ancestors, you are the auspicious sword, resembling a sword.

original: chindhi vighnān mahābhāge guhājāta namo'stu te // //
analyzed: chinddhi vighnān mahābhāge guhā jāta namaḥ astu te  /
translated: Cut off the obstacles, O greatly fortunate one, born in the cave, salutations to you.

analyzed: pradāne kṛṣṇasārasya mantraḥ yaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: This mantra is proclaimed for the gift of a black antelope.
O black antelope, the form of Brahman, the enhancer of the splendor of Brahman.

original: caturvedamayaṃ prājña prajñāṃ dehi yaśo mahat /
analyzed: catur veda mayam prājña prajñām dehi yaśaḥ mahat
translated: O wise one, consisting of the four Vedas, grant me wisdom and great fame.

analyzed: tathā śarabha pūjāyām mantram etat prakīrtitam
translated: Similarly, this mantra is proclaimed for the worship of the Sharabha.

analyzed: tvam aṣṭa pādaḥ vibhraṣṭa candrabhāga samudbhava
translated: You are the eight-footed one, arisen from the portion of the scattered moon.

analyzed: aṣṭamūrte mahā bāho bhairava ākhya namaḥ astu te  /
translated: O eight-formed one, O mighty-armed one, O one named Bhairava, salutations to you.

analyzed: yathā bhairava rūpeṇa varāhaḥ nihataḥ tvayā
translated: Just as the boar was killed by you in the form of Bhairava,

analyzed: tathā śarabha rūpeṇa ripūn vighnān niṣūdaya
translated: In the same way, destroy the enemies and obstacles in the form of Sharabha.

analyzed: hariḥ tvam hara rūpeṇa yathā vahasi caṇḍikām
translated: Just as you bear Chandrika in the form of Hara,

original: tathā śubhāni me nityaṃ bahuvighnāṃśca sūdaya // //
analyzed: tathā śubhāni me nityam bahu vighnān ca sūdaya
translated: In the same way, always destroy the many obstacles and grant me auspicious things.

analyzed: tvam hariḥ siṃha rūpeṇa jagat pratyūha rūpiṇam
translated: You are Hari, who in the form of a lion, killed Hiranyakashipu,

analyzed: jaghāna yena satyena hiraṇyakaśipum haran   /
translated: the form of obstruction to the world, by the truth of which you took away.

analyzed: iti evam siṃha pūjāyām kramaḥ uktaḥ mayā anagha
translated: Thus, O sinless one, the sequence has been told by me in the worship of the lion.

analyzed: nare sva gātra rudhire paryāyam śṛṇu bhairava
translated: O Bhairava, listen to the method in one's own blood and body.

original: pīṭhe ced dīyate martyo baliṃ dadyāt śmaśānake /
analyzed: pīṭhe ced dīyate martyaḥ balim dadyāt śmaśānake
translated: If the mortal is offered on a seat, the offering should be made in a cremation ground.

analyzed: śmaśānam heruka ākhyam tu tat pūrvam pratipāditam
translated: The cremation ground is called Heruka, which has been explained earlier.

original: kāmākhyānilaye śaile oḍādau viddhi tat kramam /
translated: Know that sequence in the mountain abode of Kamakhya, beginning with Oḍa.

original: mama rūpaṃ śmaśānaṃ tad bhairavākhyaṃ ca kathyate // //
analyzed: mama rūpam śmaśānam tat bhairava ākhyam ca kathyate
translated: That cremation ground is said to be my form, called Bhairava.

analyzed: tatra aṅga tvam tapaḥ siddhau tri bhāgām tu bhaviṣyati
translated: There, in the attainment of austerity, the body will be divided into three parts.

analyzed: pūrva aṅge bhairava ākhye tu samutsṛṣṭiḥ narasya tu
translated: In the eastern part, called Bhairava, the man is abandoned.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa aṅge śiraḥ dadyāt bhairavyā muṇḍa mālayā
translated: In the southern part, the head should be given, in the garland of skulls of Bhairavi.

analyzed: rudhiram paścima aṅge tu heruka ākhye niyojayet
translated: Blood should be placed in the western part, called Heruka.

analyzed: dattvā sampūjya tu naram visṛjya āgamana krame
translated: Having given and worshipped the man, he should be released in the sequence of coming.

analyzed: pīṭha śmaśāneṣu balim na īkṣet tu bali dīpakam
translated: The offering and lamp should not be seen in the cremation grounds of the seats.

analyzed: anyatra api yatas yatra dīyate yat mahā baliḥ
translated: Even elsewhere, from where the great oblation is offered,

analyzed: tatra api anyatra ca utsṛjyat śitvā anyatra śiraḥ mṛtam
translated: there too, having abandoned elsewhere and cut off elsewhere, the nectar of the head,

original: niyojayet sādhakastu visṛjya na vilokayet /🔽sasnātaṃ manujaṃ dīptaṃ pūrvāhṇaniyatāśanam // //
analyzed: niyojayet sādhakaḥ tu visṛjya na vilokayet  sa snātam manujam dīptam pūrvāhṇa niyata aśanam
translated: the practitioner should engage, having dismissed, without looking.🔽The man who has bathed, who is radiant, who has eaten in the morning with restraint,

analyzed: māṃsa maithuna bhogyena hīnam sraj candana ukṣitam
translated: who is devoid of meat, sexual enjoyment, and is anointed with garlands and sandalwood paste,

analyzed: kṛtvā uttarā mukham tam tu tad aṅgeṣu aṅga devatāḥ
translated: having made him face north, one should worship the deities of the limbs on his limbs.

original: pūjayet taṃ tu nāmnā tu daivatena ca mānuṣam /
analyzed: pūjayet tam tu nāmnā tu daivatena ca mānuṣam
translated: One should worship him by his name and also the human being by the deity.

analyzed: tad brahmarandhre brahmāṇam tad nāsāyām ca medinīm
translated: In his brahmarandhra, one should worship Brahma, and on his nose, the earth,

analyzed: karṇayoḥ tu tathā ākāśam jihvāyām sarvatomukham
translated: in his ears, likewise space, on his tongue, the all-faced one,

analyzed: jyotīṃṣi netrayoḥ viṣṇum vadane paripūjayet
translated: in his eyes, one should worship the light and Vishnu in his mouth.

analyzed: lalāṭe pūjayet candram śakram dakṣiṇa gaṇḍataḥ
translated: On his forehead, one should worship the moon, and on his right cheek, Indra,

analyzed: vāma gaṇḍe tathā vahnim grīvāyām samavartinam
translated: and on his left cheek, likewise Agni, and on his neck, the all-encompassing one.

analyzed: keśa agre nirṛtim madhye bhrūvoḥ ca api pracetasam
translated: On the tip of his hair, Nirriti, in the middle, and on his eyebrows, Pracheta,

original: nāsāmūle tu śvasanaṃ skandha cāpi dhaneśvaram // //
analyzed: nāsā mūle tu śvasanam ca api dhaneśvaram  /
translated: at the base of his nose, the breath, and on his shoulders, also the lord of wealth.

analyzed: hṛdaye sarpa rājam tu pūjayitvā paṭhet idam
translated: Having worshipped the king of serpents in the heart, one should recite this:

analyzed: nara varyam mahābhāga sarva deva maya uttama
translated: O best of men, O greatly fortunate one, O supreme one consisting of all gods,

analyzed: rakṣa mām śaraṇa āpannam sa putra paśu bāndhavam
translated: protect me who has sought refuge, along with my sons, animals, and relatives.

analyzed: sa rājyam mām saha amātyam catur aṅga samanvitam
translated: Protect me along with my kingdom, ministers, and the four divisions of the army,

analyzed: rakṣa parityajya prāṇān maraṇe niyate sati
translated: even at the cost of your own life, when death is certain.

analyzed: mahā tapobhiḥ jñānaiḥ ca yajñaiḥ yat sādhyate imṛtam
translated: The nectar that is attained through great austerities, knowledge, and sacrifices,

original: tanme dehi mahābhāga tvaṃ cāpi prāpnuhi śriyam /
analyzed: tat me dehi mahābhāga tvam ca api prāpnuhi śriyam
translated: grant that to me, O greatly fortunate one, and you too shall attain prosperity.

analyzed: rākṣasāḥ ca piśācāḥ ca vetāla ādyāḥ sarīsṛpāḥ
translated: Rakshasas, pishachas, vetalas, and other reptiles,

original: nṛpāśca ripavaścānye na māṃ te dhnantu tvatkṛte /
analyzed: nṛpāḥ ca ripavaḥ ca anye na mām te dhnantu tvad kṛte
translated: kings, enemies, and others - may they not kill me on your account.

analyzed: tvad kaṇṭha nāla galitaiḥ śoṇitaiḥ aṅga saṃyutaiḥ
translated: With the blood flowing from your throat, along with your body,

analyzed: āpyāyasva ātma vat mṛtvā maraṇe niyate sati
translated: nourish yourself as if you were alive, when death is certain.

analyzed: evam sampūjya vidhivat pūrva tantraiḥ ca pūjayet
translated: Having thus worshipped in the prescribed manner, one should worship with the previous Tantras.

analyzed: pūjitaḥ mad sva rūpaḥ yaḥ dikpāla adhiṣṭhitaḥ bhavet
translated: When worshipped, this form of mine shall be presided over by the guardians of the directions.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhitaḥ tathā anyaiḥ ca brahma ādyaiḥ sakalaiḥ suraiḥ
translated: And likewise presided over by others, by all the gods beginning with Brahma,

translated: Forest garland, then Sevantī, Kumuda, Kadambaka,
